components.description: A vertical line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing up and down.
components.title: Up Down Arrow

description: A vertical line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing up and down.
title: Up Down Arrow

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: A vertical line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing up and down. Up-down Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the name http://emojipedia.org/up-down-arrow/
emoji_net_data.name: up-down arrow

bn:00108482a: In an angle of 90° to the ground.
At right angles to the plane of the horizon or a base line

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00075652n: A symbol is an object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, visual image, belief, action, or material entity.
Symbols are things such as particular forms or marks which represent some sort of information, an idea, a physical entity or a process but is distinct from it.
In programming, a name that represents a register, an absolute value, or a memory address (relative or absolute).
A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
One or a few characters, a picture or an other concrete representation of an idea, a concept and the like.
An object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, belief, action, or material entity
An arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance
Something that represents an idea, a process, or a physical entity
